article.headline: SE Missouri 81, Longwood 77
article.story: LAS VEGAS -- Calvin Williams scored a career high 22 points and grabbed 11 rebounds, and Southeast Missouri State beat Longwood 81-77 Friday in the third round of the Las Vegas invitational tournament. Kenard Moore added 18 points for the Redhawks (2-3), who won despite blowing a 12-point lead in the last nine minutes. Dana Smith led Longwood (3-4) with a career high 26 points and nine rebounds. Durann Neil added 14 points and Kevin Swecker scored 10 points for the Lancers. Trailing 67-55, Longwood went on a 14-2 run to tie it at 69 with 3:33 remaining. Southeast Missouri State scored the next five points to go ahead for good. Longwood had a chance to tie in final 30 seconds, but the Redhawks' Bijon Jones forced a jump ball as Ryan Bogan was driving to the hoop. Jaycen Harning and Johnny Hill each had 11 points apiece for Southeast Missouri State. The Redhawks led 45-36 at intermission and never trailed in the second half.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
